Hand Sanitizer Is the Newest Weapon to Fight Nazis 
New Yorkers used hand sanitizer to clean up subway car defaced with swastikas. Facebook By Peter Wade Feb 5, 2017 Pro-Nazi and anti-Semitic messages were scrawled in permanent marker on a New York City subway, but quick thinking New Yorkers found a way to Macgyver the swastikas away. Gregory Locke posted three photos to his Facebook page on Saturday evening showing the defaced subway car and people wiping away the hateful messages, using hand sanitizer to remove the permanent ink. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "One guy got up and said, 'Hand sanitizer gets rid of Sharpie. We need alcohol.' He found some tissues and got to work," Locke wrote, "I've never seen so many people simultaneously reach into their bags and pockets looking for tissues and Purell. Within about two minutes, all the Nazi symbolism was gone." If only hand sanitizer were an effective weapon against Nazis in person, too. Wouldn't that be convenient. More from Esquire:
